Study Title: Bendamustine Plus Rituximab Versus CHOP Plus Rituximab
Brief Summary: The study addresses the question if the first line therapy of low malignant and mantle cell lymphomas with bendamustine plus rituximab is comparable (non inferior) with CHOP plus rituximab with regard to progression free survival (PFS).
Conditions: Non-Hodgkin Lymphomas|Follicular Lymphomas|Immunocytomas|Lymphocytic Lymphomas|Marginal Zone Lymphomas
Interventions: DRUG: Bendamustine|DRUG: Standard chemotherapy CHOP + Ritiximab
Primary Outcome Measures: Progression free survival, observation 3 years or significant differences between two arms
Secondary Outcome Measures: Determination and comparison of remission rates, of toxicity, infectious complications, overall survival, EFS, TTNT, capacity of peripheral blood stem cell mobilization, ongoing
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: StiL Head Office; Justus-Liebig-University, Giessen, 35392, Germany
